metadata.title: USN-7052-1 -- GNOME Shell vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that GNOME Shell mishandled extensions that fail to reload, possibly leading to extensions staying enabled on the lock screen. An attacker could possibly use this issue to launch applications, view  sensitive information, or execute arbitrary commands. (CVE-2017-8288)  It was discovered that the GNOME Shell incorrectly handled certain keyboard inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to invoke keyboard shortcuts, and potentially other actions while the workstation was locked. (CVE-2019-3820)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7052-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  gnome-shell - 3.18.5-0ubuntu0.3+esm1 gnome-shell-common - 3.18.5-0ubuntu0.3+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
